properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney WorldPride Rainbow Republic will be the final event to close out the WorldPride festival kicking off from 3pm, finishing by 10pm.

With more than 20,000 people expected, traffic will be heavier than usual within the Sydney CBD including Macquarie St, College St and William St.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area. Roads will be closed within and outside the Domain to allow crowds to safely arrive and leave the event.

Road closures:

Clearways will also be in effect on the eastern side of Hospital Rd from 12pm midday to 11.30pm.

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Sydney Gay & Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade as part of WorldPride is expected to be bigger than ever this year as the parade returns to its traditional on-road route. Hundreds of thousands of spectators will line the streets to see the parade travel from Hyde Park to Moore Park via Oxford St, Flinders St and Anzac Pde from 7:30pm until around 11.30pm.

Road closures and parking restrictions will be in place from as early as 2pm and most roads remain closed until 2am Sunday.

KEY ROAD CLOSURES

  • From 2pm to 1am: sections of College St, Wentworth Ave and surrounding local streets.
  • From 3pm to 3am: sections of Bourke St, Campbell St and surrounding local streets.
  • From 4pm to 4am: Flinders St between Oxford St and Moore Park Rd, and southbound Anzac Pde from Moore Park Rd to Lang Rd, including the Eastern Distributor Randwick Anzac Pde off-ramp (Bondi exit remains open). Anzac Pde closes northbound from 5pm.
  • From 4.30pm to 1am: Liverpool St between Elizabeth St and College St, and local streets in Surry Hills between Elizabeth St and Riley St
  • From 4.30pm to 2am: Oxford St between College St and Darlinghurst Rd, sections of Crown St, sections of South Dowling between Oxford St and Fitzroy St, and local streets off Oxford St.
  • From 6.30pm to 2am: sections of Moore Park Rd and Driver Ave (until 10am Sunday).
  • From 9pm to 1am: sections of Elizabeth St, Castlereagh St and Pitt St between Market and Goulburn streets will close to allow crowds to safely leave the CBD. 

Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the CBD and Moore Park and to expect delays as traffic will be heavy on detour routes.

Motorists travelling between the city and eastern suburbs will be diverted via Cleveland St in the south or via William St and Darlinghurst Rd in the north.  

Pedestrian access across the parade route will be available at Riley St, Crown St and Albion St from 4.30pm to 7pm, after such time there is no pedestrian crossing of Oxford or Flinders Streets available until roads reopen. 

Special event clearways will be in effect between 6am Saturday and 3am Sunday on various roads along and surrounding the parade route in the Sydney CBD, Darlinghurst, Surry Hills and Moore Park. 

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Sydney WorldPride's Oxford Street Party will see Oxford St closed to all vehicle traffic for two days on Saturday 4 and Sunday 5 March.

Motorists will be diverted via Kings Cross or Surry Hills around Oxford St during the closure. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time as delays are expected on detour routes including Cleveland St, William St and Darlinghurst Rd.

  • Oxford St between College St and Flinders St
  • Flinders St northbound lanes from Moore Park Rd to Oxford St

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 12.01am Saturday 4 March until 4.30am Monday 6 March on Oxford St, Flinders St, Albion St, Crown St, Liverpool St, South Dowling St, Wentworth Ave and surrounding local roads.

Closures for Pride Villages on Riley St, Crown St and surrounding local roads will already be in place from 2am Sun 26 Feb. Clearways will also already be in effect on these streets until 4.30am Mon 6 March.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. With over 80,000 fans expected, significant traffic delays on roads approaching the precinct on Friday during the already busy evening peak.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. The Sydney WorldPride Pride March will see 50,000 participants march across the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

The Harbour Bridge and major roads in the city and North Sydney will be closed from 4am.

The Sydney Harbour Tunnel will remain open however delays are expected. Motorists are urged to avoid the area until after 11.30am where possible.

Key road closures

  • From 2am to 12.30pm: sections of Pacific Hwy at North Sydney near Harbour Bridge off-ramp
  • From 4am to 11:30am: Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed in both directions including the Cahill Expressway Circular Overpass. In North Sydney, sections of Walker St, Blue St, Arthur St, Hill St and Pacific Hwy will close. In the Sydney CBD, Art Gallery Rd, Boomerang Pl, Hospital Rd, Mrs Macquaries Rd, Prince Albert Rd, St Mary’s Rd and Yurong Pkwy will close.
  • The Harbour Bridge walkway and cycleway will remain open. The Cahill Exp Walkway will be closed from 6am to 11am.
  • There will be no access between the Cahill Expressway and Macquarie St until after 12pm. Motorists travelling eastbound on the Cahill Expressway Circular Quay Overpass will be diverted via the Domain Tunnel. 
  • From 4am to 12pm: roads in the Sydney CBD including sections of Macquarie St, Bridge St, Hunter St, College St, Conservatorium Rd, Phillip Ln, St James Rd and Prince Albert Rd.

Special event clearways will be in effect on various key roads in the city and North Sydney between 1am and 12pm.

  • In North Sydney from 1am to 11.30am: on sections of Arthur St, Berry St, Blue St, Broughton St, Falcon St, Lavender St, Middlemiss St, Miller St, Mount St Olympic Drive, Pacific Hwy and Walker St. Some clearways will be in effect from 12.30am on Pacific Hwy.
  • In Sydney CBD from 1am to 12pm: on sections of Bent St, Bridge St, Castlereagh St, College St, Conservatorium Rd, Hunter St, Macquarie St, Park St, Prince Albert Rd, Shakespeare Place, St James Rd and St Mary’s Rd.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney WorldPride's Bondi Beach party will be held near Bondi Pavilion on Saturday 4 March. The event starts from 3pm finishing by 10pm.

With more than 15,000 people expected traffic approaching Bondi Beach will be heavy along Bondi Rd, Old South Head Rd and Syd Einfeld Dr. Motorists should avoid the area where possible or allow plenty of extra travel time and prepare for delays. 

Local roads and carparks at Bondi Beach will be closed before, during and after the event between 27 Feb and 5 Mar including sections of Queen Elizabeth Dr and Park Drive South. In North Bondi, the Medland-Bamford Ramp from Military Rd will be closed from 6am to 6pm on Saturday.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on various roads between 10am and 11pm on Saturday including Campbell Pde, Bondi Rd, Gould St, Edgecliff Rd, Grafton St, Hall St, Notts Ave and Roscoe St. Clearways will also be in effect prior to the event on Park Dr South from 27 Feb and Queen Elizabeth Dr from 3 Mar.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Large crowds are expected to attend A Day On The Green concert featuring Sting at Centennial Vineyards in Bowral from 3pm to 10pm.

The speed limit will be reduced along Mittagong Rd and Old Hume Highway approaching the site from 12pm until 12am. Traffic controllers will be on site to manage traffic flow on Mittagong Rd at Kirkham Rd and Old Hume Hwy at Centennial Rd.

Centennial Rd will be closed at Old Hume Hwy between 8pm and 12am to allow concert traffic to exit safely.

The Newcastle Beerfest will be held on Saturday 18 February 2023 from 11.00am to 5.30pm at Kind Edward Park. There will be increased pedestrian activity before, during and after the event. Please follow the direction of the traffic control in place.
Tweed Enduro is held on Saturday 18 February 2023 at Pottsville from 6.00am to 4.00pm. Please follow signage and local traffic management in place.

Mardi Gras Fair Day at Victoria Park in Camperdown from 10am to 9pm.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual as thousands of people travel to and from the park for the event.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 5am to 9.30pm on the following roads:

  • City Rd between Carillon Ave and Parramatta Rd western side
  • City Rd between Cleveland St and Butlin Ave eastern side
  • Parramatta Rd between City Rd and University Ave southern side

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even for local residents or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Parramatta Road and City Road around Broadway as music fans make their way to Victoria Park to celebrate NYE. Extensive road closures will be in place in and around the Sydney CBD - some roads start closing from as early as 4am. Use public transport where possible. If you have to drive or are using taxis or rideshare, allow additional travel time.
